lead_paragraph: Joaquín Guzmán Loera’s meeting with the movie star Sean Penn gave the authorities a break they needed to help recapture him. So did a big order of tacos.

byline.contributor: Paulina Villegas and Elisabeth Malkin contributed reporting from Mexico City, and Frances Robles from Miami.

headline.print_headline: How El Chapo Was Finally Captured, Again
headline.main: How El Chapo Was Finally Captured, Again

snippet: Joaquín Guzmán Loera’s meeting with the movie star Sean Penn gave the authorities a break they needed to help recapture him. So did a big order of tacos.
abstract: Drug kingpin Joaquin Guzman Loera's final flight from Mexican authorities involved slog through sewers, carjackings, days of survival in mountains and taco order that tipped police off to his hiding place; Guzman's capture brings to close one of Mexico's most exhaustive manhunts and points to his potent symbolic power and threat to Mexican authorities' attempts to define their country's image.
